001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.io.Serial;
004import java.util.Random;
005import java.util.stream.IntStream;
006
007import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
008import static java.util.stream.IntStream.range;
009import static java.util.stream.IntStream.rangeClosed;
010import static org.apache.commons.lang3.ArrayUtils.swap;
011import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreStreamUtils.reversedArr;
012
013/**
014 * Helper-wrapper over standard {@link Random} to generate random arrays and strings
015 */
016public class RandomHelper extends Random {
017
018    @Serial
019    private static final long serialVersionUID = 123456789_002L;
020
021    /**
022     * Constructs an <b>un-reproducible</b> instance of {@link RandomHelper}
023     */
024    public RandomHelper() {
025        super(); // non-reproducible random sequences !!!
026    }
027
028    /**
029     * Constructs a <b>reproducible</b> instance of {@link RandomHelper}
030     */
031    public RandomHelper(long seed) {
032        super(seed);
033    }
034
035    /**
036     * Getting a random lowercased string
037     *
038     * @param len the length of string to returns
039     * @return a random string of lower-cased letters
040     */
041    public String randomLowerCase(int len) {
042        return ints(len, 'a', 'z' + 1)
043            .mapToObj(chInt -> (char)chInt)
044            .map(String::valueOf)
045            .collect(joining());
046    }
047
048    /**
049     * Getting a random uppercased string
050     *
051     * @param len the length of string to returns
052     * @return a random string of upper-cased letters
053     */
054    public String randomUpperCase(int len) {
055        return ints(len, 'A', 'Z' + 1)
056            .mapToObj(chInt -> (char)chInt)
057            .map(String::valueOf)
058            .collect(joining());
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * @param lowBound lower bound of the range (inclusive)
063     * @param highBound higher bound of the range (exclusive)
064     * @return the array of elements in range {@code [ lowBound ; highBound )} that was shuffled
065     */
066    public int[] randomRangeArr(int lowBound, int highBound) {
067        return shuffle(range(lowBound, highBound));
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * @param lowBound lower bound of the range (inclusive)
072     * @param highBound higher bound of the range (inclusive)
073     * @return the array of elements in range {@code [ lowBound ; highBound ]} that was shuffled
074     */
075    public int[] randomRangeClosedArr(int lowBound, int highBound) {
076        return shuffle(rangeClosed(lowBound, highBound));
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Collects the passed stream of {@code int}s into an array and shuffle it with {@link #shuffleArr(int[])}
081     *
082     * @param values stream of primitive {@code int}s
083     * @return an array of inpiut elements that are shuffled
084     */
085    public int[] shuffle(IntStream values) {
086        int[] valuesArr = values.toArray();
087        shuffleArr(valuesArr);
088        return valuesArr;
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Swap elements of the passed array in random way.
093     * The number of swaps equals to the length of array.
094     *
095     * @param valuesArr an array to shuffle
096     */
097    public void shuffleArr(int[] valuesArr) {
098        // a little bit more efficient than using Collections.shuffle and subsequence copying
099        for (int i = valuesArr.length; i > 1; i--) {
100            swap(valuesArr, i - 1, nextInt(valuesArr.length));
101        }
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Getting an array of eventually {@code N} <b>distinct</b> integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )}.
106     *
107     * @param N the size of array to return (in a very rare cases the actual case could be less)
108     * @param lowBound low boundary of random range (inclusive)
109     * @param highBound high boundary of random range (exclusive)
110     * @return an array of eventually {@code N} <b>distinct</b> integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )}.
111     */
112    public int[] randomDistinctIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
113        return ints(5 * N, lowBound, highBound)
114            .distinct().limit(N).toArray();
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Getting an array of eventually {@code N} integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )},
119     * which are <b>sorted</b> in <b>ascending</b> order, but <b>not distinct</b>.
120     *
121     * @param N the size of array to return (in a very rare cases the actual case could be less)
122     * @param lowBound low boundary of random range (inclusive)
123     * @param highBound high boundary of random range (exclusive)
124     * @return an array of eventually {@code N} <b>sorted</b> integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )}.
125     */
126    public int[] randomSortedIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
127        return ints(N, lowBound, highBound)
128            .sorted().limit(N).toArray();
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Getting an array of eventually {@code N} integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )},
133     * which are <b>sorted</b> in <b>descending</b> order, but <b>not distinct</b>.
134     *
135     * @param N the size of array to return (in a very rare cases the actual case could be less)
136     * @param lowBound low boundary of random range (inclusive)
137     * @param highBound high boundary of random range (exclusive)
138     * @return an array of eventually {@code N} <b>sorted</b> integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )}.
139     */
140    public int[] randomSortedReversedIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
141        return reversedArr(randomSortedIntArr(N, lowBound, highBound));
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Getting an array of eventually {@code N} <b>distinct</b> integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )},
146     * which are <b>sorted</b> in <b>ascending</b> order. The bounds and the size are recommended to be large enough.
147     *
148     * @param N the size of array to return (for small ranges the returning size could be less)
149     * @param lowBound low boundary of random range (inclusive)
150     * @param highBound high boundary of random range (exclusive)
151     * @return an array of eventually {@code N} <b>sorted</b> and <b>distinct</b> integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )}.
152     */
153    public int[] randomIncreasingIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
154        return ints(5 * N, lowBound, highBound)
155            .distinct().limit(N).sorted().toArray();
156    }
157
158    /**
159     * Getting an array of eventually {@code N} <b>distinct</b> integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )},
160     * which are <b>sorted</b> in <b>descending</b> order. The bounds and the size are recommended to be large enough.
161     *
162     * @param N the size of array to return (for small ranges the returning size could be less)
163     * @param lowBound low boundary of random range (inclusive)
164     * @param highBound high boundary of random range (exclusive)
165     * @return an array of eventually {@code N} <b>sorted</b> and <b>distinct</b> integers in the range {@code [ lowBound, int highBound )}.
166     */
167    public int[] randomDecreasingIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
168        return reversedArr(randomIncreasingIntArr(N, lowBound, highBound));
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Getting an array of size {@code N} with zero({@code 0})-elements
173     *
174     * @param N the size of array to return
175     * @return an array of {@code N} zero({@code 0})-elements
176     */
177    public static int[] zeroIntArr(long N) {
178        return constantIntArr(N, 0);
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Getting an array of size {@code N} with all elements equal to {@code constant}
183     *
184     * @param N the size of array to return
185     * @return an array of size {@code N} with all elements equal to {@code constant}
186     */
187    public static int[] constantIntArr(long N, int constant) {
188        return IntStream.generate(() -> constant).limit(N).toArray();
189    }
190}
